title: Science AAAS
text:
Science – Grade 5
Copyright Behavioral Research and Teaching (BRT) 2025

S05ESS1.1 – Brightness of the Sun and Stars
ODE Standard: 5-ESS1-1
Oregon Science Standard: Support an argument that the apparent brightness of the Sun and stars is due to their relative distances from Earth.
Essentialized Standard: Recognize that the Sun is brighter than other objects on Earth and in space.
Low, Medium, and High Parameters







Level
Description




Low (L)
Compare the Sun to common objects that do not shine on their own (e.g., toy, rock).


Medium (M)
Compare the Sun to objects in the sky like clouds, airplanes, or the Moon.


High (H)
Recognize the Sun is brighter than other stars because it is closer to Earth.

title: ELA AAAS
text:
English Language Arts (ELA)
Copyright Behavioral Research and Teaching (BRT) 2025

E05RI3.1 – Text Structure and Connection
ODE Standard: 5.RI.3
Oregon ELA Standard: Explain the relationships or interactions between two or more individuals, events, ideas, or concepts in a historical, scientific, or technical text based on specific information in the text.
Essentialized Standard: Identify a connection between two ideas or events in a text.

Low, Medium, and High Parameters







Level
Description




Low (L)
Recognize two people or things mentioned in a short passage.


Medium (M)
Identify how two things in a passage are alike or different.


High (H)
Identify the connection between two things (e.g., cause/effect) in a short text.

title: Math AAAS
text:
Skip to main content


 Print to PDF


Oregon Essentialized Assessment Framework (EAF) – Mathematics
Copyright Behavioral Research and Teaching (BRT) 2025

M04NBT2.1 – Place Value Understanding
ODE Standard: 4.NBT.2
Oregon Math Standard: Read and write multi-digit whole numbers using base-ten numerals, number names, and expanded form. Use understanding of place value within these forms to compare two multi-digit numbers using >, =, and < symbols.
Essentialized Standard: Compare two-digit numbers using understanding of base-ten place value.

Low, Medium, and High Parameters










Level
Description




Low (L)
Identify which of two whole numbers (under 40) is greater using digit comparison.


Medium (M)
Match a number (under 60) to its base-ten numeral or expanded form.


High (H)
Use number comparison to solve a simple word problem with numbers up to 60.

title: ORExt AAAS
text:
This site provides access to the Alternate Academic Achievement Standards (AAAS) for multiple content areas.
Select a subject below to explore the standards.





Explore Essentialized Science Standards, aligned with Oregon academic content standards.






View Essentialized Math Standards, organized by grade level and complexity.






Access Essentialized ELA Standards with Low, Medium, and High instructional parameters.






The EAF is designed to help educators provide meaningful, accessible instruction for students with the most significant cognitive disabilities while maintaining alignment to Oregon’s academic content standards.





Use the subject cards above or the navigation bar at the top.
Each page includes:

Original Oregon content standard
Essentialized standard
Low, Medium, and High parameters

Standards are updated as Oregon content standards change.
